meanings.definition: A group of people working together, especially one that operates a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The crews on the ship worked together to navigate through the storm.
meanings.sent2: The airline crews ensured the passengers' safety during the flight.
meanings.sent3: The crews on the pirate ship argued over who should steer the vessel.
meanings.sent4: The crews of the spaceship sailed through the galaxy of stars.
meanings.sent5: The crews on the fishing boat caught a bounty of fish for dinner.

meanings.definition: The group of people who work on a film or television set.
meanings.sent1: During the movie shoot, the crews set up the lights and cameras.
meanings.sent2: The film crews worked tirelessly to capture the perfect scene.
meanings.sent3: The crews on the movie set enjoyed a break between takes.
meanings.sent4: The crews behind the scenes made the actors shine on screen.
meanings.sent5: The crews in the studio brought the director's vision to life.

meanings.definition: A group of people who work together on a specific task or project.
meanings.sent1: The construction crews built the new bridge in record time.
meanings.sent2: The research crews collaborated to publish an important study.
meanings.sent3: The cleaning crews transformed the messy room into a spotless space.
meanings.sent4: The gardening crews planted colorful flowers in the park.
meanings.sent5: The repair crews fixed the broken machine with skill and speed.
